Schedule

Event Sessions

  • 9/15/22 @ 5p EST - KICKOFF and Jupyter Notebooks (2hrs) [Checkin/Training]
    Presenter: Je'aime Powell [ ] - Senior HPC Systems Administrator and Researcher | Texas advanced Computing Center

    [Description/Topics]
    Checkin #1: Team mentors will be assigned. (20 minutes) Training: Jupyter Notebooks introduction for use towards reproducable science.


  • 9/22/22 @ 5p EST - Poster Template Usage (2hrs) [Checkin/Training]
    Presenter: Jeff Wood [ ] - Education Program Manager (Retired 🎉) | Science Gateways Community Institute

    [Description/Topics]
    Checkin #2: Teams introduce themselves and their nest 3 day tasks (20 minutes) Training: Poster template for final presentations


  • 9/29/22 @ 5p EST - Qwiic Labs CloudyCluster in the Classroom (2hrs) [Checkin/Training]
    Presenter: Boyd Wilson [ ] - Technologist and product focused executive | Omnibond

    [Description/Topics]
    Checkin #3: Teams give update on their progress (20 minutes) CloudyCluster Training: Qwiic Labs CloudyCluster in the Classroom


  • 10/6/22 @ 5p EST - Oak Ridge National Labs (ORNL) (2hrs) [Checkin/Training]
    Presenter: Elijah MacCarthy [ ] - HPC Engineer | Oak Ridge National Laboratory

    [Description/Topics]
    Checkin #4: Teams give update on their progress (20 minutes) Training: [ORNL]Pathways to Supercomputing Initiative for HBCUs/MSIs


  • 10/13/22 @ 5p EST - GitHub (2hrs) [Checkin/Training]
    Presenter: Je'aime Powell [ ] - Senior HPC Systems Administrator and Researcher | Texas advanced Computing Center

    [Description/Topics]
    Checkin #5: Teams give update on data sets, resources and use cases. (20 minutes) Training: Github usage for project deliverable hosting


  • 10/18/22 Poster Presentations (2hrs) [Gateways22]


  • 10/20/22 Conference Attendance (2hrs) [Gateways22]


About

Bring your energy and enthusiasm to this years hackthon. Leave with technical excellence, enabled by Omnibond and the NSF-funded Science Gateways Community Institute (SGCI) along with partners such as Intel HPC, ORNL, Voltron Data, Google Cloud, TACC, and Globus. We have joined forces in creating a diverse new generation of HPC data scientists and programmers.
